white: Trying to learn choral-ography to songs like "I'll Be Seeing You" or "Aeternam".
Trying my best to sing when sick.
Ghosting that really hot singer in my choir cause trying to play hard to get.
Walking down that lonesome road, all by yourself.
Stopping completely.
They call it accidentals cause they're accidents.
B flat?.
Just pretending like you know the words.
Forgetting where to stand.
Warming up with horse flutters while covering your mouth to avoid the splash zone.
Juicy colour chords.

Craig HELLA Johnson.
Stagger breathing in "The Fruit of Silence".
Feet shoulder width apart, arms by your side, chin down, chest forward.

Singing to the grandma in the back pew so she can hear me.
When you don't know what note your singing because of leger lines.
Casually harmonizing to choir songs at parties.

Cringing to non-choir folks trying to sing because of our struggle for perfect intonation.
Trying to clap, slap, stomp and sing at the same time.
Learning that somewhere out in the world there exists a white card that says "Waking up next to Andrew Bortz".
When you realize how sad it is that we never got to perform "Ohtul" in concert.
